docs.snippet: ON October 12, 1972, a Fairchild F-227 of the Uruguayan Air Force, chartered by an amateur rugby team, set off from Montevideo in Uruguay for Santiago in Chile. Reports of bad weather in the Andes brought the plane down in Mendoza, a small town on...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON October 12, 1972, a Fairchild F-227 of the Uruguayan Air Force, chartered by an amateur rugby team, set off from Montevideo in Uruguay for Santiago in Chile. Reports of bad weather in the Andes brought the plane down in Mendoza, a small town on the Argentinian side of the range.

headline.main: Alive; Cannibals & Christians The Story of the Andes Survivors. By Piers Paul Read. Illustrated. 352 pp. Philadelphia and New York: J. B. Lippincott Company. $10. D. Keith Mano is author of six novels of which "The Bridge" is the most recent.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO--As they face endless lines for milk and vegetable oils, shortages of rice and sugar and inaccessible prices for meat, many Brazilians have begun to ask
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO--As they face endless lines for milk and vegetable oils, shortages of rice and sugar and inaccessible prices for meat, many Brazilians have begun to ask
docs.abstract: rev of events in Brazil notes that news censorship still exists; Brazilian daily O Estado de Sao Paulo continues to publish classical poetry in censored spaces and Jornal da Tarde fills its spaces with recipes; only improvement in press is appearance of newsmagazine Veja without cuts, indication that censor had been pulled out of newsroom

headline.main: In Brazil All Is Not As It Seems; Stability First

docs.snippet: Two of the survivors of a 1972 plane crash who had to subsist on the flesh of their dead companions to survive in the snows of the Andes say they have become better, stronger and more religious men for their experience.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two of the survivors of a 1972 plane crash who had to subsist on the flesh of their dead companions to survive in the snows of the Andes say they have become better, stronger and more religious men for their experience.

docs.snippet: A key member of the deposed Allende Government in Chile, Pedro Vuskovic Bravo, flew into exile here today after spending more than seven months in asylum in the Mexican Embassy in Santiago.
docs.lead_paragraph: A key member of the deposed Allende Government in Chile, Pedro Vuskovic Bravo, flew into exile here today after spending more than seven months in asylum in the Mexican Embassy in Santiago.
docs.abstract: Pedro Vuskovic Bravo, key member of deposed Allende Govt in Chile goes into exile in Mex after spending several mos in asylum in Mex Embassy in Santiago; succeeded in entering Mex Embassy after coup d'etat and remained there despite repeated refusals by Chilean junta to grant him safe-conduct out of country; junta accused Vuskovic of stealing typewriter from govt agency Corfo for legal purposes and may apply for his extradition from Mex on basis of theft charge; Mex's firmest objective was to obtain safe conduct for Vuskovic noting Chilean officials were privately told that new commercial deals depended on Vuskovic's release (S)

headline.main: Chile Allows Key Allende Aide to Leave

docs.snippet: As men and women around the world observed May Day, the international workers' holiday yesterday, celebrations in the great Communist capitals, Moscow and Peking, were marked by an air of informality and relaxation.
docs.lead_paragraph: As men and women around the world observed May Day, the international workers' holiday yesterday, celebrations in the great Communist capitals, Moscow and Peking, were marked by an air of informality and relaxation.
docs.abstract: Underground Communist party urges followers to refrain from demonstrating for fear that clashes with police might prompt Portuguese Govt to abandon promises of greater freedom (S)
